column3:
Concept ACK as discussed in #bitcoin-builds
```
2021-02-10 10:14:27     hebasto `python-vm-builder` package is not available in distros after bionic; should we maintain the `--kvm` option for `gitian-build.py` script?
2021-02-10 10:15:39     hebasto wumpus: luke-jr: ^
2021-02-10 10:16:55     wumpus  i personally always use LXC
2021-02-10 10:17:08     hebasto me too :)
2021-02-10 10:17:

Concept NACK. Ubuntu isn't the only distro out there.\n\nBesides, vmbuilder doesn't even work to *create* bionic either, so it's been irrelevant for a while. It's not very hard to install in KVM manually.

At present I have a custom script that is similar, but this isn't about me personally...

>Sure, but Ubuntu is the only distro used for building bitcoin core gitian binaries.

*Within* gitian, yes, but not the only one *outside* gitian.
> Within gitian, yes, but not the only one outside gitian.\n\nThis script is only relevant to gitian. It's not called `gitian-build.py` for nothing.

Rebased b4bc7208294d34c1407a4e30a6a0ac45b96dea43 -> ef14d90172e2278b362171763805ac41a6d7779e ([pr21140.01](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/commits/pr21140.01) -> [pr21140.02](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/commits/pr21140.02)) due to the conflict with #21130.\n

>This script is only relevant to gitian. It's not called gitian-build.py for nothing.\n\nYes, and gitian runs fine on non-Ubuntu platforms... The only Ubuntu-specific thing about (our) gitian usage is the OS run *within* the VM gitian manages.

I think it's better to close this. There are clear differences in opinion here and it's unclear how much debating a small cleanup like this even matters with the move to GUIX in progress (and this script disappearing completely).
> I think it's better to close this. \n\nAgree. There's not really any harm to leave this as-is for now.

> I think it's better to close this. There are clear differences in opinion here and it's unclear how much debating a small cleanup like this even matters with the move to GUIX in progress (and this script disappearing completely).\n\nRight.
